description: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) is a chronic autoimmune disease that can affect many parts of the body. It can cause inflammation, pain, and damage to the joints, skin, kidneys, brain, and other organs.
prevalence: SLE affects about 1 in 2,000 people worldwide, with rates varying by ethnicity.

description: Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) is a chronic autoimmune disease that affects the joints. It causes inflammation, swelling, and pain in the joints, which can lead to joint damage and disability.
prevalence: RA affects about 1% of the population worldwide.

description: Scleroderma is a chronic autoimmune disease that affects the skin, blood vessels, and internal organs. It causes hardening and thickening of the skin, and can also cause fibrosis and damage to internal organs.
prevalence: Scleroderma affects about 1 in 2,500 people worldwide.

description: Antiphospholipid Antibody Syndrome (APS) is an autoimmune disorder that causes the formation of antibodies that attack phospholipids. These antibodies can damage blood vessels throughout the body, leading to a variety of complications including blood clots, strokes, and miscarriages.
prevalence: APS affects about 1 in 5,000 people worldwide.
description: Behçets Disease is a chronic autoimmune disease that can affect the eyes, skin, mouth, genitals, and nervous system. It causes inflammation, ulcers, and pain in these areas.
prevalence: Behçets Disease affects about 1 in 500 people worldwide.
description: Lupus Nephritis is an inflammation of the kidneys that can occur in people with SLE. It can cause damage to the kidneys, leading to kidney failure.
prevalence: Lupus Nephritis affects about 50% of people with SLE.

description: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (GPA) is a rare autoimmune disease that affects the blood vessels in the nose, sinuses, lungs, and kidneys. It causes inflammation, swelling, and narrowing of the blood vessels, which can damage these organs.
prevalence: GPA affects about 1 in 50,000 people worldwide.

description: Microscopic Polyangiitis (MPA) is a rare autoimmune disease that affects the small blood vessels in the kidneys and lungs. It causes inflammation, swelling, and narrowing of the blood vessels, which can damage these organs.
prevalence: MPA affects about 1 in 1 million people worldwide.
description: Schizophrenia is a severe mental disorder that causes a person to lose touch with reality. It is characterized by hallucinations, delusions, and disorganized thinking and speech.
prevalence: Schizophrenia affects about 1% of the population worldwide.

description: Schizoaffective Disorder is a chronic mental illness that combines features of schizophrenia and mood disorders, such as bipolar disorder or depression. People with schizoaffective disorder experience psychotic symptoms, such as hallucinations or delusions, as well as mood symptoms, such as mania or depression.
prevalence: Schizoaffective disorder affects about 0.3% of the population worldwide.

treatment: Treatment for schizoaffective disorder includes medications to manage symptoms and psychotherapy to help people learn to cope with the disorder.
